column2: silvercandiez, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I loved these vitamins! I took them during my entire pregnancy. I never felt nauseous. The vitamin pill was small and easy to swallow, no after taste at all. I do wish they were available over the counter as they were more expensive than regular prenatal vitamins. Overall, I think this is a great choice for people like me who hate the taste of vitamins like me.

column2: Not Crazy About It, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Likes:  I did like that the medication did not have an aftertaste.Dislikes:  This medication gave me SEVERE constipation.  Another downside is cost.  While all medications I've taken cost me either $10/$20, this one costs me $50 monthly.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The pills did not make me sick.  I did not experience any nausea.  There was no after taste.  I have acid reflux and there are some days where I do burp within the hour and it tastes like orange juice but that is as bad as the taste gets.  Overall, very wonderful and worth the prescription!

column1: Prevention of Fetal Neural Tube Defects when Pregnant
column2: Nicola, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am taking this medication to prepare me for pregnancy and it is great. It does not taste bad, easy to swallow, and has actually increased my bowel movements. I have taken other PNV in the past and they taste horrible, made me nauseated, and caused severe constipation.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have the chewables and it tastes like berries.  Love that!!  And the DHA pill is easy to take too.  What a wonderful idea.

column2: jglassk, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 14 weeks preganant and have taken several other prenatals since I have become pregnant. The aftertaste was awful for most of them and they made me sick. This one was recommended to me by my doctor to try and as of yet has not made me sick. It has increased my BM as well which is wonderful! Its easy to take due to the smaller size  with no aftertaste. I highly recommend this prenatal!

column2: jen, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Soon2BMommy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Out of all the prenatal vitamins that I've used, I must say that this one has been great.  I hate taking pills however, this one is smaller than the average prenatal vitamin and is very easy to swallow.  Unlike other pills, there's no aftertaste, no nausea and they only need to be taken once a day.  Highly recommended!

column2: Mommytobe, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This is the second prenatal vitamin I have taken during my pregnancy. This prenatal vitamin did not make me nauseous. It did not make me constipated either but it did decrease the frequency of bowel movements. Overall, I would recommend this prenatal vitamin because of the size of the pills. Plus, it is easy to take.

column2: cache30, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am taking vitafol pre pregnancy. I have read many posts about prenatals that cause nausea. This drug has not caused any nausea for me or any other side effect. It has increased my energy level. the best thing is that unlike most prenatals it is easy to take. The pills are smaller than average vitamins and it doesnt leave an aftertaste/metallic taste in your mouth. Best yet no constipation.  I would strongly recommend these to woman ttc or those mothers already expecting.
